title: hope
comment: In Scripture, a confident expectation for the future, describing both the act of hoping and the object hoped for. When grounded in God, hope provides the motivation to live the Christian life even in the face of trouble.

children.title: hope, nature of
children.comment: Hope, in its general sense, is the anticipation of a future outcome. It is a subjective expectation which may be either firmly based or misdirected.

children.title: Hope that an event will take place

seealsos.comment: Felix hoped Paul would offer him a bribe
Paul hoped to visit Rome on his way to Spain

children.title: Hope for a positive outcome
Misplaced or vain hope
Hope removed or not satisfied

seealsos.comment: The two disciples share their hopes with Jesus Christ on the Emmaus road

children.title: The malicious hope of the wicked
hope, in God
children.comment: A total grounding of one's confidence and expectation in God's goodness and providential care even in the face of trouble.

children.title: Hope in God is commanded
Hope can be placed in Scripture as the word of God
Hope can be placed in God in the face of difficulty or trial
The outcome of hoping in God
It brings security and confidence

seealsos.comment: There is no shame for those who hope in the LORD
The LORD helps and protects those who hope in him

children.title: It leads to specific results
hope, as confidence
children.comment: Hope means more than a vague wish that something will happen. It is a sure and confident expectation in God's future faithfulness and presence. The horizon of Christian hope extends beyond death into an eternity prepared by God himself, the reality of which is guaranteed by Jesus Christ.

children.title: God and Jesus Christ are the hope of believers
The hope of resurrection and eternal life

primaryrefs.comment: The Sadducees did not believe in the resurrection whereas the Pharisees did

children.title: The hope of future glory
Hope is a Christian virtue
The effect of future hope on living now

seealsos.comment: Hope induces a longing for what will be when Jesus Christ returns

children.title: hope, results of its absence
children.comment: An absence of hope leads to a loss of vision, a sense of despondency and ultimately to despair. This contrasts sharply with the Christian hope.

children.title: Feelings produced by a lack of hope
Despair
A sense of being abandoned by God
A deep longing for life to end
The outcome of a lack of hope
The choice of trusting in God or futile self-effort
Suicide
hope, results of
children.comment: Hope gives believers confidence and reassurance in this present life, allowing them to lead effective lives for God. It also reassures them of the reality of eternal life, allowing them to face death with confidence.

children.title: Hope reassures believers in this present life
Hope reassures believers in their faith
Hope encourages believers
Hope encourages believers to rejoice
Hope encourages believers to look for restoration
Hope leads to more effective Christian living and witness
Hope encourages believers to be bold
Hope encourages believers to evangelise
Hope leads to godly living
Hope equips believers for spiritual warfare
Hope enables believers to face suffering with confidence
Hope enables believers to face the future with confidence
Hope assures believers of an eternal dimension to life
Hope enables believers to face death with confidence
Hope assures believers of their eternal life
Hope enables believers to face the coming wrath with confidence
Hope assures believers of their heavenly inheritance
